$DATUM Syntheses of B: To a THF solution (30 mL) of A (1.50 g, 5.98 mmol) was
added a mixture of imidazole (0.81 g, 11.90 mmol) and NaOH (0.29 g, 7.25
mmol) in 10 mL of THF. The reaction mixture was stirred overnight at
ambient temperature, while the completion of the reaction was confirmed
by TLC monitoring. Solvents were dried in vacuo and the residue was
subjected to silica gel column chromatography using ethyl acetate and
hexane (1:2, V:V) as eluent. The 2-((imidazol-1-yl)methyl-6-bromopyridine
derivative (B1) (1.36 g, 5.48 mmol) (Yield 91.3 %). Formation of B1 was
confirmed by 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 7.51 (s, 1H, NCHN), 7.41 (t, J H-H = 7.7
Hz, 1H, py-H), 7.31 (d, J H-H = 7.9 Hz, 1H, py-H), 6.99 (s, 1H,
imidazole-H), 6.89 (s, 1H, imidazole-H), 6.76 (d, 1H, py-H), 5.12 (s, 2H,
CH 2); 13C NMR (CDCl3): δ 157.51, 141.74, 139.6, 137.6, 129.9, 127.4,
120.0, 119.5, 51.6 (CH2); and mass spectrometry (MALDI): m/z 237, 235 [M
- 1]+; 158 [M - Br]+.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of
bis(3,5-bis((1H-imidazol-1-yl)methyl)-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)methane (L).
The synthetic procedure was applied following the comparative method as
described for titb.s3 Imidazole (0.82g, 12mmol) and potassium hydroxide
(3.3g, 60mmol) were dissolved in dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO) (35mL) and the
mixture was stirred for 3h at room temperature, then
bis(3,5-bis(bromomethyl)-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)methane (1.87g, 3mmol) was
added. After stirring for another 6h at room temperature, an equivalent
volume of water was added to the mixture. The aqueous solution was
extracted with chloroform (4 × 35 mL). The combined organic extracts were
washed with water and dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate. Solvent was
removed and excess diethyl ether was added to the residue. After standing
overnight at -18°C, the white powder was filtered, washed with diethyl
ether and dried in vacuum. Yield: 1.59g (91%).
bis(3,5-bis((1H-imidazol-1-yl)methyl)-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)methane (L),
yield (1.59g, 91%) IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3110 (m), 2986 (m), 1655 (w),
1511 (s), 1485 (sh), 1452 (sh), 1388 (s), 1274 (m), 1224 (vs), 1108 (s),
1075 (s), 1023 (m), 915 (m), 907 (sh), 812 (s), 731 (s), 696 (m), 664
(s), 618 (m), 517 (w). 1H NMR (CD3OD) δ 7.563 (s, 4H, HIm), 7.106 (s, 4H,
HIm), 7.013 (s, 4H, HIm), 5.474 (s, 8H, -CH2-), 4.529 (s, 2H, -CH2-),
2.437 (s, 6H, -CH3), 2.245 (s, 12H, -CH3). Anal. Calcd for C35H40N8: C
73.40, H 7.04, N 19.56. Found (%): C 73.37, H 7.12, N 19.51.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 90
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7778-53-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-64-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.2. Synthesis of the
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)-imidazoles. The
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)-imidazoles were synthesized according to a
literature method [12]. Typically, a mixture of imidazole (1 mM) and
dehydrated K3PO4 (1 mM) in acetone (5 mL) was stirred for 10 min in an
ice bath, and then carbon disulfide (3 mM) was added. The reaction
mixture was stirred for an additional 30 min and then halide (1 mM) was
added. Stirring was continued at room temperature until the reaction was
complete, which can be monitored by thin layer chromatography (TLC). The
precipitate was filtered and washed with acetone. The solvent was
evaporated under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by
chromatography on a silica gel column (petroleum ether/EtOAc = 5 : 1) to
give the desired product. Benzyl 1H-imidazole-1-carbodithioate (3).
Yellow viscous oil; yield 90%. IR (cm-1): 1478 (C-N), 1069, 1003 (C-S),
823 (SCS), 1260, 1225 (imidazole); 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6): δ 4.62 (s,
2H, CH2), 7.11 (d, J = 1.2 Hz, 1H, ArH), 7.27-7.41 (m, 5H, ArH), 7.77 (d,
1H, J = 1.2 Hz, ArH), 8.48 (s, 1H, ArH).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM reactant assumed (stage 3)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Activated Monomers. For assays
analyzed by mass spectrometry, oxyazabenzotriazolides of deoxynucleotides
(OAt esters) were synthesized via activation of dNMPs with EDC/HOAt, as
previously described.24 Mixing of equimolar quantities of the four OAt
esters as previously described19 gave solutions that were directly used
for assays. Imidazolides of dNMPs were prepared via redox condensation
using imidazole, 2,2'-dithiodipyridine, and triphenylphosphine, as
described for ribonucleotides by Lohrmann and Orgel.25 Briefly, a mixture
of the dNMP (0.1 mmol, previously dried at 0.1 mbar), imidazole (68 mg, 1
mmol), and 2,2'-dithiodipyridine (66 mg, 0.3 mmol) was dissolved in a
mixture of DMF/DMSO (1.5 mL, 1:1, v:v) under argon. Triethylamine (50 μL,
0.3 mmol) and triphenylphosphine (53 mg, 0.2 mmol) were added to the
reaction mixture. After being stirred for 2.5 h at room temperature, the
clear yellow solution was added dropwise to a cold solution of sodium
perchlorate (50 mg, 40 mmol) in a mixture of diethylether/acetone (20 mL,
1:1, v:v) and triethylamine (1.5 mL, 10 mmol). After being stirred for 30
min and subsequent centrifugation, the supernatant was aspirated, and the
pellet was washed with diethylether/acetone (20 mL, 1:1, v:v). After
centrifugation, the resulting colorless pellet was dried at 0.1 mbar and
stored at -20 °C. 4c, yield: 60-90%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM dropwise addition of reaction mixture from stage 1 in stage 2, substage
1, solvent ratio: 1:1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cascade of reduced speed and accuracy after errors in enzyme-free copying
of nucleic acid sequences
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Leu, Kevin; Kervio, Eric; Obermayer, Benedikt; Turk-MacLeod, Rebecca M.;
Yuan, Caterina; Luevano, Jesus-Mario Jr.; Chen, Eric; Gerland, Ulrich;
Richert, Clemens; Chen, Irene A.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2013), 135(1), 354-366

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of
1-(3-Aryloxy-3- arypropyl)-1H-imidazoles 11, 15-28, 30-37, and 39-50.
Example. 1-(3-Phenoxy-3-phenylpropyl)-1H-imidazole (11). A mixture of 77
(0.54 g, 0.0022 mol) and imidazole (0.49 g, 0.0072 mol) in anhydrous DMF
(3.49 mL) was refluxed for 24 h. After cooling, the reaction mixture was
diluted with water and extracted with ethyl acetate. The organic layer
was separated, washed with brine, and dried. Removal of the solvent gave
a crude product, which was purified on silica gel columm (ethyl acetate
as eluent) to afford 11. Yield 59%, as a yellow oil.
1-[3-(2,4-Dichlorophenoxy)-3-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)propyl]-1Himidazole
(44). 44 was prepared as 11 using 111. Yield 90%, as a yellow oil. 1H NMR
(CDCl3): δ 2.28-2.41 (m, 2H), 4.20-4.26 (m, 1H), 4.35-4.41 (m, 1H),
5.23-5.28 (dd, J = 3.56 and 9.19 Hz, 1H), 6.34 (d, J = 8.86 Hz, 1H), 6.90
(s, 1H), 6.98-7.01 (dd, J = 2.52 and 8.34 Hz, 1H), 7.07 (s, 1H),
7.22-7.24 (dd, J = 1.92 and 8.34 Hz, 1H), 7.35 (s, 1H), 7.38-7.39 (m,
2H), 7.43 ppm (s, 1H). Anal. (C18H14Cl4N2O (416.13)) C, H, Cl, N.

$DATUM 960243-04-3

$DATUM polystyrene-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
5-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)pyridin-2-amine (6n) Following the general procedure,
imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with 2-amino-5-bromopyridine
(0.104 g, 0.6 mmol). The crude product was purified over a silica gel
column using ethyl acetate to give a light yellow solid (90% yield). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 4.74 (bs, 2H), 6.57 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 1H), 7.14 (s,
1H), 7.19 (s, 1H), 7.42 (2d, J = 2.8, 2.4 Hz, 1H), 7.69 (s, 1H), 8.12 (d,
J = 2.4 Hz, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (75MHz, CDCl3): δ 108.7, 119.5, 125.7,
130.3, 132.5, 136.2, 142.1, 158.2 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 160 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst (polymer-supported ionic liq.-copper complex)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A Concept of Supported Amino Acid Ionic Liquids and Their Application in
Metal Scavenging and Heterogeneous Catalysis
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(45), 13879-13886

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1,1'-(1,5-Pentamethylene)bis(imidazole) (8). To a solution of imidazole
(5.00 g, 73 mmol) in anhydrous tetrahydrofuran (50 mL) was introduced
pieces of potassium metal (2.90 g, 73 mmol) under nitrogen atmosphere.
1,5-Dibromopentane (7.5 g, 35 mmol) was added dropwise just after the
addition of potassium metal over a period of 30 min, and the mixture was
heated to reflux for 12 h. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature and filtered. The white solid residue was dissolved in water,
and the solution was extracted with ether (3 x 100 mL). The combined
organic fractions were concentrated in vacuo to give 8. Colorless oil,
yield 90%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 1.45 (m, 2 H), 1.95 (q, 4 H), 3.95 (t, J =
7.1 Hz, 4 H), 6.82 (s, 2 H), 7.10 (s, 2 H), 7.45 (s, 2 H); MS (m/z rel.
intensity) 204.136 (M+), 82.053 (100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of imidazoles (5a-c, e-f). To a
solution of 4 (6 mmol) in acetonitrile (40 mL) was added imidazole (18
mmol) and 1,1'-carbonyldiimidazole (9mmol). The mixture was then heated
under reflux for 2-12 h. Then the reaction mixture was allowed to cool
and the solvent removed under reduced pressure. The oil formed was then
extracted with CH2Cl2 (50 mL) and washed with water (2 X 50mL). The
recombined organic layers were dried (MgSO4), filtered and reduced in
vacuo. Purification by column chromatography (CH2Cl2-MeOH 100:0 v/v
increasing to 96:4 v/v) gave the product.
4-{[4-(Benzoxazol-2-ylamino)phenyl]imidazol-1-yl-methyl}benzoic acid
methyl ester (5c). Yield: 90%, yellow syrup. Rf 0.21 (EtOAc). 1H-NMR
(CDCl3): δ 8.52 (bs, 1Η, NH), 7.96 (d,2H,J = 8.2 Hz, Ar), 7.59 (d, 2H, J
= 8.5 Hz, Ar), 7.38 (d, 2H, J = 7.5 Hz, Ar), 7.22 (d, 1H, J = 7.9Hz, Ar),
7.18 (m, 1H, Ar), 7.08 (m, 6H, Ar), 6.79 (m, 1H, Ar), 6.45 (s, 1H, H-7),
3.86 (s, 3H, CH3). 13C-NMR (CDCl3): δ 166.47 (C, C-14), 157.82 (C, C-22),
147.78 (C, C- 20), 144.19 (C, C-8), 142.21 (C, C-1), 139.82 (CH, C-23),
138.67 (C, C-21), 132.46 (C, C-6), 130.28 (C, C-13), 130.18 (CH, C-11,
C-12), 129.57 (CH, C-4, C-5), 127.78 (CH, C-9, C-10), 125.94 (CH, C-25),
124.32 (CH, C-17), 122.63 (CH, C-24), 122.13 (CH, C-16), 119.33 (CH, C-2,
C-3), 117.36 (CH, C-19), 109.12 (CH, C-18), 64.37 (CH, C-7), 52.29 (CH3,
C-15). HRMS (EI) calcd for (M)+425.1608, found, 425.1610.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Experimental Procedures C for the
Cu(I)-catalyzed One-pot Synthesis of 2-Imidazylbenzimidazoles 6 Using
o-Haloarylcarbodiimides (Table 2). An oven-dried Schlenk tube was charged
with a magnetic stir bar, imidazole or 2-methylimidazole 5 (0.6 mmol, 1.2
equiv.), CuI (10 mg, 0.05 mmol, 10 mol%), 1,10-Phen·H2O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol,
20 mol%), and Cs2CO3 (326 mg, 1.0 mmol, 2.0 equiv.). The Schlenk tube was
capped with a Teflon screwcap, and then evacuated and backfilled with N2
(this sequence was carried out three times). Under a positive pressure of
N2, dioxane (1.5 mL) was added via syringe and the mixture was
pre-stirred at 60 °C in a preheated oil bath for 10 min. Then a solution
of o-haloarylcarbodiimide 1 (0.5 mmol, 1.0 equiv.) in dioxane (1.5 mL)
was added dropwise via syringe (for about 30 min). The tube was sealed
and the mixture was allowed to stir at the indicated temperature for
24-36 h. The reaction was stopped and cooled to room temperature. The
reaction mixture was directly passed through celite and rinsed with an
additional 30 mL of AcOEt. The combined filtrate was concentrated by
rotatory evaporation, and the residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate (1:1
v/v) as eluent to give the corresponding product 6. The product could be
further purified by recrystallization from warm Et2O.
2-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)-1-phenyl-1H-benzo[d]imidazole (6b). m.p. 107- 109
°C; IR (neat) v 3054, 1593, 1543, 1435, 1326, 1068, 1018, 826, 744, 696
cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.83(d, J = 8.0 Hz, 1H), 7.79 (s, 1H),
7.58-7.62 (m, 3H), 7.30-7.41 (m, 4H), 7.22 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 7.14 (s,
1H), 7.07 (s, 1H) ppm; 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 142.7, 140.4, 136.8,
135.8, 134.3, 130.5, 130.0, 129.8, 126.8, 123.9, 123.7, 119.7, 118.6,
110.4 ppm; Anal. Calcd. for C16H12N4: C 73.83, H 4.65, N 21.52, found: C
73.94, H 4.59, N 21.49; EI-MS: m/z = 260 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM anhydrous condition required, sealed tube used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Synthesis of N-Substituted 2-Heterobenzimidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Lv, Xin; Bao, Weiliang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(15), 5618-5621

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM (b) Preparation of N-(geranyloxybutyl)imidazole Sodium hydride (1.1 g 60%
dispersion in oil, 0.66 g, 27.5 mmol) was weighed out in a 100 mL round
bottom flask. The sodium hydride was washed with hexane (3x5 mL) to
remove the mineral oils. DMF (anhydrous, 20 mL) was added, followed by
geranyloxybutyl bromide (1.51 g, 5.47 mmol). The reaction mixture was
stirred at room temperature under N2 for a couple of minutes. Imidazole
(1.84 g, 103 mmol, 27.1 equiv) was added slowly in small portions while
cooling in an ice bath. The addition of imidazole was exothermic and the
reaction mixture bubbled vigorously becoming initially a milky off-white
and then clear brown in colour. This was left stirring at room
temperature overnight. The reaction mixture was diluted with chloroform
(50 mL) and then it was washed with brine (3x50 mL), and dried (Na2SO4).
The solvent was removed under reduced pressure followed by high vacuum to
give the product as a brown oil (1.37 g, 90%).
N-(geranyloxybutyl)imidazole, yield (1.37 g, 90%).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM exothermic
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Improving the ozone fastness of sulfonated dyes in inks
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Indusegaram, Sutharsiny; Gonzaga, Graciel; Vonwiller, Simone Charlotte;

Silverbrook, Kia

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2l. Yield 90%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

the coupling of aryl chlorides with aliphatic, aromatic, and
N(H)-heterocyclic amines

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-Methyl-2-pyrazol-1-yl-1H-indole (3a)
(General Procedure): To the mixture of 1-methylindole (63 μL, 0.5 mmol)
and pyrazole (85 mg, 1.25 mmol) in 1,4-dioxane (0.3 mL) was added a
saturated aqueous NH4OOCH solution (0.3 mL), and then I2 (254 mg, 1.25
mmol) was added at rt. The reaction mixture was stirred at room
temperature for 24 hours, and then a saturated aqueous Na2S2O3 solution
(1 mL) was added. The mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (2 × 20
mL). The combined organic layer was washed with brine (10 mL) and dried
over anhydrous magnesium sulfate, filtered and concentrated in vacuo. The
crude product was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(petroleum ether/ethyl acetate = 20/1) to give 3a.
2-Imidazol-1-yl-1H-indole (4g): The crude product was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether/ethyl acetate = 1/1) to
give 4d as white solid (82 mg, 90%). Mp 162-163 °C (reported: 162.5-163
°C); 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d6): δ 11.94 (br s, 1H), 8.30 (s, 1H), 7.76
(s, 1H), 7.54 (d, 1H, J = 8.0 Hz), 7.42 (d, 1H, J = 8.0 Hz), 7.17-7.13
(m, 2H), 7.09-7.05 (m, 1H), 6.60 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, DMSO-d6): δ
135.8, 133.9, 132.7, 129.7, 127.4, 121.7, 120.2, 120.0, 118.4, 111.4,
89.9;

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Experimental Procedure for the
Arylation of Azole Azole (0.5 mmol), aromatic halide (0.5 mmol), CuI (10
mol%), ligand (10 mol%) and NaOMe (1 mmol) were located in a flask with
DMSO (1.5 mL). The mixture was heated at the corresponding temperature
for 12 h. The reaction mixture was filtrated by SiO2 and extracted with
EtOAc (3 × 8 mL). The combined organic was concentrated and subjected to
SiO2 column to give target products. 3s, yield 90%. 1H NMR (CDCl3,
500MHz): δ = 8.28 (s, 1H), 8.03 (dd, 1H), 7.69 (d, 2H), 7.30 (d, 1H),
7.11 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (CDCl3, 125MHz): δ = 145.1, 137.1, 133.6, 132.0,
131.1, 130.7, 129.5, 125.6, 123.1, 120.1. ESI-MS: 258 [M+H]+.

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM To a suspension of 60% NaH (0.08 g, 2 mmol) in DMF (4 mL) under nitrogen
at 0 °C was added a solution of imidazole (0.14 g, 2 mmol) in DMF (4 mL).
The mixture was stirred for 30 min before a solution of the above
mesylate (0.25 g, 1 mmol) in DMF (4 mL) was added dropwise. The mixture
was heated at 60 °C for 2 h before being quenched with H2O (40 mL) and
then extracted with EtOAc (3 × 30 mL). The combined organic extracts were
washed with brine (3 × 30 mL), dried over MgSO4, filtered, and
concentrated to afford 2a.
1-(1,4-Dioxaspiro[4,5]dec-8-ylmethyl-1H-imidazole (2a), colorless oil,
yield (0.20 g, 90%). 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ = 1.22-1.36 (m, 2 H), 1.48-1.56
(m, 2 H), 1.62 (d, J = 5.6 Hz, 2 H), 1.70-1.80 (m, 3 H), 3.80 (d, J = 6.8
Hz, 2 H), 3.90-3.97 (m, 4 H), 6.88 (s, 1 H), 7.05 (s, 1 H), 7.43 (s, 1
H). 13C NMR (CDCl3): δ = 27.6, 33.9, 38.0, 52.5, 64.2, 64.3, 108.4,
119.2, 129.4, 137.4. HRMS-FAB: m/z [M+H]+ calcd for C12H19N2O2: 223.1446;
found: 223.1434.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM The reaction of carbonyldiimidazole with alcohols to form carbamates and
N-alkylimidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Tang, Yuanqing; Dong, Yuxiang; Vennerstrom, Jonathan L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2004), (15), 2540-2544

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-(1,1-Dimethy2-Methoxyethyl) Amino-2-(1-Imidazolyl Imidazolyl)
Quinazoline DihydrochlorideA mixture of the compound prepared in Example
28 (165 mg, 0.62 mmol), imidazole (169 mg, 2.48 mmol) and phenol (0.7 g)
is heated at 150°C. for 40 min. After cooling, the reaction mixture is
diluted with ethyl acetate, and washed with 1N KOH and brine, and dried
over MgSO4The filtrate is concentrated to leave a viscous oil, which is
purified on 8 g of silica gel column eluting with 50% ethyl acetate in
hexane to obtain the title compound. Yield 165 mg, 90% (Mp: 223°-225°C).
NMR (CDCI3): delta 1.65 (s, 6H), 3.48 (s, 3H), 3.58 (s, 2H), 6.32 (broad,
1H), 7.17 (s, 1H), 7.40 (m, 1H), 7.62-7.81 (m, 3H), 7.97 (s, 1H), 8.67
(s, 1H).NMR (200 MHz, DMSO-d6) delta: 9.80 (s, 1H), 8.59 (m, 1H), 8.34
(m, 1H), 7.84-7.96 (m, 3H), 7.78 (m, 1H), 7.60 (m, 1H), 3.78 (s, 2H),
3.29 (s, 3H), 1.57 (s, 6H). IR(KBr) nu: 1633, 1610, 1562,1520, 1474,
1397, 1108, 754 cm-1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: N-Arylation of Azoles with Arylboronic Acid at
Ambient Conditions; General Procedure. Cu2O (0.055 mmol) was added to a
mixture of azole (1.2 mmol) and arylboronic acid (1 mmol) in MeOH (3 mL)
at r.t., and the mixture was stirred for 5 h under an atmosphere of air.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC and on completion of
the reaction, the mixture was centrifuged and the centrifugate was
concentrated under reduced pressure to give the crude product. The crude
product was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(hexane-EtOAc, 70:30) to afford the N-arylated azoles.
1-(2-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 1, entry 4), yield 90%. 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.59 (br s, 1 H), 7.37-7.28 (m, 3 H), 7.23-7.20 (m,
2 H), 7.06 (br s, 1 H), 2.19 (s, 3 H). 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ =
148.2, 138.4, 135.6, 130.7, 130.1, 118.4, 114.0, 111.1, 107.7. HRMS: m/z
calcd for C10H10N2 (M+): 158.084; found: 158.084.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst reusable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper(I) oxide-catalyzed N-arylation of azoles and amines with
arylboronic acid at room temperature under base-free conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, Bojja; Venkanna, Gopaladasu T.; Kumar, Kota Balaji Shiva;
Balasubrahmanyam, Vura
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2008), (5), 795-799

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Compound 3a-h; General Procedure A mixture of
imidazole (0.34 g, 5 mmol) and anhyd K3PO4 (1.06 g, 5 mmol) in acetone
(20 mL) was stirred at r.t. for 5 min, and then carbon disulfide (1.14 g,
15 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred for additional 10
min, and then halide (5 mmol) was added. Stirring was continued at r.t.
until the reaction was completed (monitored by TLC). The precipitate was
filtered and washed with acetone. The solvent was evaporated under
reduced pressure and the residue was purified by recrystallization
(petroleum ether-EtOAc) to afford the desired compounds 3a or 3h or by
chromatography on silica gel column (petroleum ether-EtOAc) to give the
desired compounds 3b-g. Compound 3d Yield: 90%; yellow viscous oil. 1H
NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 2.18 (td, J = 7.8, 4.2 Hz, 2 H, CH2), 3.50 (t,
J = 7.8 Hz, 2 H, SCH2), 3.88-4.05 (m, 4 H, OCH2CH2O), 5.02 (t, J = 4.2
Hz, 1 H, CH), 7.11 (d, J = 1.5 Hz, 1 H, ArH), 7.79 (d, J = 1.5 Hz, 1 H,
ArH), 8.48 (s, 1 H, ArH). Anal. Calcd for C9H12N2O2S2: C, 44.24; H, 4.95;
N, 11.47. Found: C, 44.05; H, 5.19; N, 11.20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A mild and efficient procedure for the synthesis of
1-(alkyldithiocarbonyl)imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM [0395]To a solution of imidazole (10.0 g, 146.9 mmole) in 100 ml dimethyl
sulfoxide at room temperature under nitrogen is added sodium hydride
(6.46 g, 161.6 mmole). The solution is stirred at 80° C. for 2 hours.
Chloromethyl ethyl ether (16.35 ml, 176.3 mmole) is added dropwise. The
reaction mixture is stirred for another 2 hour at 80° C., cooled to room
temperature, poured into 5% aqueous solution and extracted with
dichloromethane (4×200 ml). The combined organic extracts are dried over
sodium sulfate, filtered, concentrated in vacuo. The residue is fresh
chromatographed in hexane/ethyl acetate from 5:1 to 2:1 to give
1-ethoxymethyl-1H-imidazole as a brown oil 1.68 g (90%). MS(ES+):
(M+H)=127.0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-Pivaloylimidazole: General procedure for the preparation of
acyl-imidazoles and -pyrazoles: In a typical experiment imidazole (20
mmol) was dissolved in distilled CH2Cl2 (20 mL) containing TEA (20 mmol)
and cooled to 0 degC under a steady flow of argon. The requisite acid
chloride (20 mmol) dissolved in 10 mL of CH2Cl2 (distilled) was delivered
dropwise over several minutes to the stirring solution imidazole solution
at 0 degC. The mixture was allowed to warm to 25 degC and stirred at this
temperature for 2 hr to ensure completion. The reaction mixture was then
diluted with 100 mL of diethyl ether, filtered and evaporated under
reduced pressure. Purification through silica gel with hexanes:ethyl
acetate (3:1) furnished 100 % yields. According to the general procedure,
the product was obtained. 2.7 g (90 %); white solid; mp 49-50 degC.

$DATUM 67-64-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Activated Monomers. For assays
analyzed by mass spectrometry, oxyazabenzotriazolides of deoxynucleotides
(OAt esters) were synthesized via activation of dNMPs with EDC/HOAt, as
previously described.24 Mixing of equimolar quantities of the four OAt
esters as previously described19 gave solutions that were directly used
for assays. Imidazolides of dNMPs were prepared via redox condensation
using imidazole, 2,2'-dithiodipyridine, and triphenylphosphine, as
described for ribonucleotides by Lohrmann and Orgel.25 Briefly, a mixture
of the dNMP (0.1 mmol, previously dried at 0.1 mbar), imidazole (68 mg, 1
mmol), and 2,2'-dithiodipyridine (66 mg, 0.3 mmol) was dissolved in a
mixture of DMF/DMSO (1.5 mL, 1:1, v:v) under argon. Triethylamine (50 μL,
0.3 mmol) and triphenylphosphine (53 mg, 0.2 mmol) were added to the
reaction mixture. After being stirred for 2.5 h at room temperature, the
clear yellow solution was added dropwise to a cold solution of sodium
perchlorate (50 mg, 40 mmol) in a mixture of diethylether/acetone (20 mL,
1:1, v:v) and triethylamine (1.5 mL, 10 mmol). After being stirred for 30
min and subsequent centrifugation, the supernatant was aspirated, and the
pellet was washed with diethylether/acetone (20 mL, 1:1, v:v). After
centrifugation, the resulting colorless pellet was dried at 0.1 mbar and
stored at -20 °C. 4t, yield: 60-90%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM dropwise addition of reaction mixture from stage 1 in stage 2, substage
1, solvent ratio: 1:1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cascade of reduced speed and accuracy after errors in enzyme-free copying
of nucleic acid sequences
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Leu, Kevin; Kervio, Eric; Obermayer, Benedikt; Turk-MacLeod, Rebecca M.;
Yuan, Caterina; Luevano, Jesus-Mario Jr.; Chen, Eric; Gerland, Ulrich;
Richert, Clemens; Chen, Irene A.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2013), 135(1), 354-366

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedures for the Synthesis of Tetraethyl Bisphosphonate 5a-f.
Method A. A solution of compounds a-f (0.66 mmol) and 4 (200 mg, 0.66
mmol) in THF (10 mL) was kept in a microwave vial and heated to 150-160
°C for 15 min in a scientific microwave oven. After cooling at room
temperature, the solvent was evaporated in vacuo, the crude material was
dissolved in water (10 mL) and extracted with dichloromethane (2 × 15
mL). The organic layers were collected, dried, filtered, and evaporated.
The crude material was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel
with dichloromethane-methanol as eluent.
Tetraethyl-[2-(imidazol-1-yl)ethyl]-bisphosphonate (5a). Yield 90%;
yellow oil. 1H NMR δ 1.25-1.34 (m, 12H), 2.40-2.85 (m, 1H), 4.05-4.21 (m,
8H), 4.41-4.59 (m, 2H), 6.90 (s, 1H), 7.21 (s, 1H), 7.57 (s, 1H). 13C NMR
δ 13.4, 45.3, 48.2, 61.3, 121.7, 126.9, 141.6.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, alternative reaction conditions shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Aminobisphosphonates Possessing an in Vivo Antitumor Activity Through a
γδ-T Lymphocytes-Mediated Activation Mechanism

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 239. Synthesis of
2-chloro-4-(1H-pyrazol-1-yl)aniline 2-chloro-4-iodoaniline (760 mg, 3
mmol), N,N'-dimethylethylenediamine (96 μL 0.9 mmol), 1H-pyrazole (430
mg, 6.3 mmol) were dissolved in DMF (3.8 mL). CS2CO3 (1.86 g, 5.7 mmol)
and CuI (57 mg, 0.3 mmol) wrere added and the reaction was placed in a
140 °C oil bath. After 3 h, the volatiles were removed in vacuo. The
residue was diluted with dichloromethane and purified via flash column
chromatography (1% MeOH/dichloromethane). Yield : 90%.

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).

$DATUM 7646-69-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Design and synthesis of novel miconazole-based ciprofloxacin hybrids as
potential antimicrobial agents

$DATUM 1-(2-Methoxyphenyl)-1H-imidazole (6b)2 Following the general procedure,
imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with 2-bromoanisole (75 µL, 0.6
mmol). The crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give a white solid (90% yield). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 3.84 (s, 3H), 6.90 (bs, 1H), 7.02-7.07 (m, 2H),
7.20 (bs, 1H), 7.28 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 7.34 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 7.91
(bs, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3): δ 55.6, 112.2, 120.2, 120.8,
125.3, 126.3, 128.4, 128.8, 137.6, 152.4 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 174 [M+].

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for N-Arylation of Imidazole
with Aryl Bromides. A Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon stopcock are
charged with a magnetic stir bar, K2CO3 (572 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuI (0.38 mg,
0.20 mmol, 20 mol %), and per-6-amino- β -cyclodextrin (100 mg, 0.08
mmol, 8 mol %). DMSO (1 mL) was added at room temperature. Then a
solution of bromobenzene (188 mg, 1.2 mmol) and imidazole (68 mg, 1.0
mmol) in DMSO (1 mL) was added. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 110°C. Water (5 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture after completion of the reaction. Then it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated by vacuum. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel, using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:3) as
eluant, to give an oil of 1-phenylimidazole 4a (164 mg, 98%)
1-(Naphthalen-2-yl)-1H-imidazole (4o), yield 90% 1H NMR (400 MHz):
7.96-7.81 (m, 5H), 7.59 -7.51 (m, 3H), 7.46 (bs, 1H), 7.27 (s, 1H) 13C
NMR (100 MHz): 134.8, 133.5, 132.2, 130.0, 127.8, 127.8, 127.3, 126.5,
120.2, 119.1 GC-MS: m/z 193.9 (M+)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed tube used, Ullmann reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Per-6-amino-β-cyclodextrin as an Efficient Supramolecular Ligand and Host
for Cu(I)-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazole with Aryl Bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Suresh, Palaniswamy; Pitchumani, Kasi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(22), 9121-9124

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the synthesis of
lipophilic zoledronate analogs (2-16): A mixture of imidazole (100 mmol),
alkyl bromide (100 mmol) and K2CO3 (200 mmol) in acetone (200 mL) was
refluxed overnight. Upon filtration and removal of solvent, the residue
was subjected to flash chromatography with ethyl acetate as eluant to
give product Yield &gt; 90 %.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for the synthesis of lipophilic zoledronate analogs
(2-16): A mixture of imidazole (100 mmol), alkyl bromide (100 mmol) and
K2CO3 (200 mmol) in acetone (200 mL) was refluxed overnight. Upon
filtration and removal of solvent, the residue was subjected to flash
chromatography with ethyl acetate as eluant to give product Yield &gt; 90
%.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the synthesis of
lipophilic zoledronate analogs (2-16): A mixture of imidazole (100 mmol),
alkyl bromide (100 mmol) and K2CO3 (200 mmol) in acetone (200 mL) was
refluxed overnight. Upon filtration and removal of solvent, the residue
was subjected to flash chromatography with ethyl acetate as eluant to
give product Yield &gt; 90 %.

$DATUM 7646-69-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 584-08-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 60-29-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 6. meso-Mono[o-5-(N-imidazolyl)valeramidophenyl]-triphenylporphyrin (6).
Collman et al. first reported an imidazole tail porphyrin.50 Here we
synthesized PIM by a different approach. 1 (100 mg, 0.125 mmol) was
dissolved in 10 mL of degassed DMF under N2 atmosphere. A solution of 18
mg of imidazole in 2 mL of DMF was added in the presence of K2CO3, and
the resulting solution was allowed to reflux under a N2 atmosphere in the
dark for 8 h. The solution was then poured into 100 mL of diethyl ether,
washed with 100 mL of H2O, and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent
was evaporated on a rotary evaporator and the residue separated by flash
chromatography (5% MeOH in CH2Cl2). Yield: 90 mg (90%). Anal. Calcd for
C52H41N7O: C, 80.08; H, 5.30; N, 12.57. Found: C, 77.94; H, 5.95, N,
10.72. 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ -2.64 (s, 2H), 0.2-3 [8H, -(CH2)4-], 7.7-7.79
(m, 15H), 7.8 (5H), 8.83 (3H), 8.79 (1H), 8.9 (7H), 8.96 (1H). ESI-MS
(positive-ion mode, MeOH): m/z 780 (20%; [M]+). UV-vis (CH2Cl2): λmax/nm
= 420, 516, 551, 591, 647.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM in the dark (in stage 1)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM EPR, Resonance Raman, and DFT Calculations on Thiolate- and
Imidazole-Bound Iron(III) Porphyrin Complexes: Role of the Axial Ligand
in Tuning the Electronic Structure
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Das, Pradip Kumar; Chatterjee, Sudipta; Samanta, Subhra; Dey, Abhishek
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51(20), 10704-10714

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME297 STEP1

$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Addition of alcohols to E-1 and Z-1 complexes.
The 0.1 g (0.17 mmol) of complex 1 was dissolved in 2.8 mL (0.51 mmol) of
0.2 N CH3ONa in CH3OH [or in 13 mL of 0.04 N EtONa (0.51 mmol) in EtOH]
and the reaction mixture was stirred in Ar atmosphere at 50-60°C. The
course of reaction was monitored by TLC [SiO2, CHCl3/CH3COOEt (1: 3)].
Reaction was stirred to the disappearance of initial substance on
chromatogram. After the end of reaction into the reaction mixture 2 mL of
CHCl3 and 10 mL OfH2O were added, then the organic layer was separated,
washed with water, and evaporated to dryness. The product was separated
by preparative TLC [SiO2, 25 x 25 cm, CHCl3/CH3COCH3 (5:1)] and
additionally purified on the column with LH-20 [C6H6/EtOH (3:1)].
Benzylamine and imidazole were added to CH3CN (2mL) using 3 eq. of the
nucleophiles. complex 7, yield 90%. Benzylamine and imidazole were added
to CH3CN (2mL) using 3 eq. of the nucleophiles. Found, %: C 57.63; H
4.66; N 9.49. C32H29O3N5NiCl2•1.25C2H5OH. Calculated, %: C 57.65; H 5.12,
N 9.74. mp 169-171°C. [α]25D + 1900.0 (c 0.016, CHCl3). 1H NMR spectrum
(CDCl3): 1.25 (m, 1H, β -H Pro), 1.35 (d, 3H, CH3, J= 7.44 Hz), 1.80 (m,
1H, y-H Pro), 2.06 (m, 1H, β -H Pro), 2.41 (m, 2H, γ -, δ -H Pro), 2.65
(m, 1H, α -H Pro), 3.14 and 4.15 (AB, 2H, NCH2C6H3Cl2, J= 13.0Hz), 3.13
(m, 1H, CH-CH3), 3.24 (m, 1H, δ -H Pro), 4.32 (m, 1H, N-CH), 6.70-7.00
(m, 3H, Ar), 7.19-8.29 (m, 11H, Ar), 8.99 (s, 1H, Ar).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Diastereoselective synthesis of anti-β-substituted α-aminobutanoic acids
via Michael addition reactions of nucleophiles to new chiral Ni(II)
complexes of dehydroaminobutanoic acid
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 403507-51-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-031-CAS-3421395
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 90
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 78-93-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: A mixture of cholest-5-en-3β-yl
5-bromopentanoate and pyridine was kept for 6 h at 70°C and evaporated.
The residue was purified on silica gel with a chloroform–methanol (10 :
1) mixture and yielded (1) (91%). To prepare lipids (2) and (3),
imidazole (4.0 mmol) or morpholine (5.0 mmol) was added to
cholest-5-en-3β-yl 5-bromopentanoate solution (0.4 mmol) in methyl ethyl
ketone (5 mL) and the mixture was heated at 80°C for 2 h. The organic
solvent and unreacted heterocyclic base were removed in vacuum, and
amines were isolated by FC (chloroform-methanol, 50 : 1) with 90% yield.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Novel Cholesterol-Based Cationic Lipids for Gene Delivery
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Medvedeva, Darya A.; Maslov, Mikhail A.; Serikov, Roman N.; Morozova,

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
trans-Dibromo(1,3-diisopropylbenzimidazolin-2-ylidene)(1-phenylimidazole)
palladium(II) (2). A mixture of complex 1 (94 mg, 0.1 mmol) was suspended
in CH2Cl2 (10 mL). To this suspension was added a solution of
1-phenylimidazole (26 uL, 0.2 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (3 mL). The reaction
mixture was stirred at ambient temperature for 2 h. The solvent was
removed under reduced pressure, and the residue was washed with hexane.
Crystallization from a concentrated CH2Cl2/toluene solution afforded the
product as yellow crystals (110 mg, 0.18 mmol, 90%).
trans-Dibromo(1,3-diisopropylbenzimidazolin-2-ylidene)(imidazole)
palladium(II) (3). 3 was prepared in analogy with 2 from 1 (47 mg, 0.05
mmol) and imidazole (7 mg, 0.1 mmol). Slow evaporation of a concentrated
EtOH/chloroform solution afforded the product as yellow crystals (48 mg,
0.09 mmol, 90%). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ 9.96 (br, 1 H, NH), 8.30 (s,
NCHN), 7.70 (s, 1 H, CH), 7.60-7.56 (dd, 2 H, Ar-H), 7.23-7.19 (dd, 2H,
Ar-H), 6.93 (s, 1H, CH), 6.33 (m, 2H, 3J(H, H)=6.9 Hz, CH(CH3)2), 1.77
(d, 12 H, 3J(H,H)=6.9 Hz, CH(CH3)2). 13C{1H} NMR (75.47 MHz, CDCl3): δ
161.4 (s, NCN), 138.9 (s, NCHN), 134.2, 130.0, 122.8, 116.3, 113.3 (s,
Ar- Cand CH), 55.0 (s,CH(CH3)2), 21.3 (s, CH(CH3)2). Anal. Calcd for
C16H22Br2N4Pd: C, 35.81; H, 4.13; N, 10.44. Found: C, 36.17; H, 4.07; N,
10.41. MS (ESI): m/z=525 [M - Br + imidazole]+, 535 [M - H]-, 617 [M +
Br]-.

$DATUM 60-29-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-64-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Activated Monomers. For assays
analyzed by mass spectrometry, oxyazabenzotriazolides of deoxynucleotides
(OAt esters) were synthesized via activation of dNMPs with EDC/HOAt, as
previously described.24 Mixing of equimolar quantities of the four OAt
esters as previously described19 gave solutions that were directly used
for assays. Imidazolides of dNMPs were prepared via redox condensation
using imidazole, 2,2'-dithiodipyridine, and triphenylphosphine, as
described for ribonucleotides by Lohrmann and Orgel.25 Briefly, a mixture
of the dNMP (0.1 mmol, previously dried at 0.1 mbar), imidazole (68 mg, 1
mmol), and 2,2'-dithiodipyridine (66 mg, 0.3 mmol) was dissolved in a
mixture of DMF/DMSO (1.5 mL, 1:1, v:v) under argon. Triethylamine (50 μL,
0.3 mmol) and triphenylphosphine (53 mg, 0.2 mmol) were added to the
reaction mixture. After being stirred for 2.5 h at room temperature, the
clear yellow solution was added dropwise to a cold solution of sodium
perchlorate (50 mg, 40 mmol) in a mixture of diethylether/acetone (20 mL,
1:1, v:v) and triethylamine (1.5 mL, 10 mmol). After being stirred for 30
min and subsequent centrifugation, the supernatant was aspirated, and the
pellet was washed with diethylether/acetone (20 mL, 1:1, v:v). After
centrifugation, the resulting colorless pellet was dried at 0.1 mbar and
stored at -20 °C. 4g, yield: 60-90%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM dropwise addition of reaction mixture from stage 1 in stage 2, substage
1, solvent ratio: 1:1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Cascade of reduced speed and accuracy after errors in enzyme-free copying
of nucleic acid sequences

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.2 Synthesis of 4 General procedure for the
preparation of 4: A mixture of thioether 3 and imidazole or benzimidazole
(8 equiv.) in degassed glacial AcOH was stirred at 80 °C for 6 h. The
reaction mixture was quenched with an excess saturated NaHCO3 solution
and extracted with CH2Cl2 (15 mL × 3). The combined organic extracts were
washed with brine and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and
evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by
flash column chromatography to afford the corresponding (S, Rp)-4.
1-{(S)-1-[(R)-2-(iso-Propylthio)ferrocenyl]ethyl}-imidazole (4e). 3e (1
g, 3.02 mmol) and imidazole (1.64 g, 24.16 mmol) in glacial AcOH (11 mL)
were used with reference to the general procedure. Yield: 90%, orange
solid. Rf = 0.3 (EtOAc/hexane/Et3N = 1/1/0.01). [α]D20 +131.6° (c 1.0,
CH2Cl2); m.p.= 112-115 °C; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.41 (s, 1H), 6.90
(s, 1H), 6.76 (s, 1H), 5.56 (q, 1H, J = 7.0 Hz), 4.48 (s, 1H), 4.42 (s,
1H), 4.32 (s, 1H), 4.16 (s, 5H), 1.80 (d, 3H, J = 7.0 Hz), 1.78-1.74 (m,
1H), 0.89 (d, 6H, J = 5.0 Hz); 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 135.6, 128.8,
116.8, 89.9, 78.2, 76.9, 70.3, 68.3, 67.3, 50.9, 39.3, 23.4, 22.3, 22.2;
IR (cm-1) 3087, 2951, 2919, 2858, 1638, 1496, 1449, 1407, 1251, 1219,
1151, 1108, 1069, 1031, 907, 819, 740, 661; MS(EI): 354.13 [M]+;
HRMS(EI): calcd for C18H22FeN2S [M]+: 354.0853; found 354.0862.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of compounds 4a-4h Tetrahydrofuran
(20 cm3) was added to 0.68 g imidazole (10 mmol) and 0.29 g sodium
hydride (12 mmol); the suspension was stirred at room temperature for 1
h. Then, compounds 3a-3h (11 mmol) were added dropwise. After completing
the dropping, the temperature was increased to 40 °C. Upon completion of
the reaction, water was added. The resulting mixture was extracted with
dichloromethane, then dried by anhydrous sodium sulfate and subsequently
the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
purified by silica gel column chromatography (eluent: petroleum/ethyl
acetate, 3/1 v/v).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Design and synthesis of novel miconazole-based ciprofloxacin hybrids as
potential antimicrobial agents
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Monatshefte fuer Chemie (2015), 146(4), 713-720
